Cache within datasource implementation

To start deal with this cache sample you need to execute datasource.cache.initialize() in your datasource controller/service code. Base data retrieving method datasource.get() isn't changed. We didn't touch its implementation. This cache implements a facade over standard datasource.

You may disable/enable cache via datasource.cache.isEnabled property. Toggle-link demonstrates this ability. You can see the difference due to $timeout back-end delay emulation on datasource.get.

Cache is {{datasource.cache.isEnabled ? 'enabled' : 'disabled'}} [toggle]
